pages.text: Austrolimulus was Triassic xiphosuran, within family Austrolimulidae, which is related to modern horseshoe crabs (Limulidae). Known from Australia as the name suggests,  it is known from freshwater environment unlike modern horseshoe crabs. It had carapace with really long, "pickaxe-like" spines, which make the animal about 18 cm wide. It was even called like "the strangest and most extreme xiphosurid morphologies". These spines probably provided effective motion within fluvial environment.
